basics.name: Mauricio CÃ¡ceres Bravo
basics.label: Researcher
basics.summary: I am a research assistant at the Yale School of Management, based in New Haven, CT. I double-majored in mathematics and economics at the University of Utah and I have a Master's degree in economics from Columbia University in New York. I am an aspiring researcher and intend to pursue a PhD in economics. I am specially interested in public and development economics.

work.summary: I am currently working as a research assistant for Professors Fiona Scott Morton, Jason Abaluck, Kevin Williams, and Michael Sinkinson.

publications.name: The effects on insurance costs of restricting undocumented immigrants' access to driver licenses
publications.summary: This paper uses panel data on US states to examine the impact of imposing documented presence and social security number requirements to obtain a driver's license.
